image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu addresses the UN from a podium, with a QR code pinned to his blazer.

props.synopsis: Scores of delegates stage a walkout at the UN ahead of the Israeli prime minister's speech, as US President Donald Trump says: "I think we have maybe a deal on Gaza."

title.children: Netanyahu rails against foreign leaders as UN delegates walk out

image.altText: Donald Trump and Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stand shoulder to shoulder and pose for a photo at the entrance of the White House.

props.synopsis: The Gulf, along with Israel, will be wondering just how far Donald Trump really is prepared to push Benjamin Netanyahu.

title.children: The Gulf states are wondering if Trump can stop Israel

image.altText: Chika Honda looks down as she stands in a crowded space.

props.synopsis: A Japanese tourist who served 10 years in an Australian prison for drug smuggling offences sees her story reflected in the case of Australian Donna Nelson, who was sentenced to six years in a Japanese prison for smuggling 2 kilograms of methamphetamine.

title.children: How a tourist on a dream Australia trip ended up spending 10 years in prison

image.altText: A man in a suit points and looks on.

props.synopsis: During a visit with his UK counterpart, Anthony Albanese tells reporters that Australians are "concerned about elements of the far right rising" abroad.

title.children: Governments should 'not seek to divide people' PM says, amid warning on far right's rise

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, with Matt Kean and Chris Bowen behind him.

props.synopsis: As a nation, it's as if we're arguing about where to have a family holiday in 2035, and whether we fly economy or business. Meanwhile, nobody can agree on dinner tonight.

title.children: The government provided a media management masterclass on climate

image.altText: A close up of Andrew Hastie against a blue curtain.

props.synopsis: The West Australian veteran has a clear vision for the future of the Liberal Party — and he's making it known.

title.children: Andrew Hastie wants to be Liberal leader. The question is when

image.altText: Instagram posts float around head of person in beanie and hoodie in dark room, their face is lit by small slither of light

props.synopsis: Gender stereotypes "play a role" in allowing predators like Kellie Whiteside to fly under the radar, but that's not the whole story.

title.children: 'A predator is not a male or a female': How a community missed the signs of grooming

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein in a bright yellow jacket stands grinning in front of a small black plane

props.synopsis: The documents include flight logs, massage messages and cash transactions in Jeffrey Epstein's ledger.

title.children: Newly released Epstein files name Prince Andrew, Elon Musk, Bill Gates

image.altText: a man with sunglasses sits in a large chair

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals Tylere Baker-Pearce, a former political candidate who has posted a selfie smiling outside Auschwitz, was the man charged with performing a Nazi salute at an AFL game.

title.children: Identity revealed of man charged with Nazi salute at AFL game

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield and Lachie Neale smile while holding the premiership cup and standing in front of a crowd of fans

props.synopsis: When they meet at the MCG on Saturday afternoon, Geelong and Brisbane are bidding for more than just the 2025 premiership. For the two most dominant clubs of a generation, true greatness is at hand.

title.children: The AFL's 21st-century titans meet in a grand final 25 years in the making

image.altText: A composite image of six different couples in various locations.

props.synopsis: Each of these eight families left the mainland in search of Tasmania's cooler, milder climate. But with challenges like health care, transport and limited services, do they have any regrets over the decision?

title.children: These families all moved to Tasmania for the climate, but was it worth it?

image.altText: A smiling young man with a neck tattoo.

props.synopsis: Caleb Pokai says he was banned from entering the Burleigh Pavilion while out dinner with friends due to his tā moko.

title.children: Māori man refused entry to Gold Coast venue due to cultural tattoo

image.altText: Police are investigating after two bodies were found in Coffs Harbour.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after the bodies of a man and woman were found in northern New South Wales.

title.children: Breaking: Police investigate after two bodies found in New South Wales home

image.altText: Yuna sits down on the floor while Minu holds a mickey mouse toy.

props.synopsis: Minu and Yuna Jo's bodies lay in a storage unit for four years. They finally have justice after their mother was found guilty of their murders seven years after they were killed.

title.children: For four years, the bodies of Yuna and Minu Jo lay in a suitcase in a storage unit

image.altText: A young female student on a computer screen using AI to make art.

props.synopsis: The AI dystopia might already be here but there are some things only humans can teach our children.

title.children: As AI takes over, I'm putting my faith in teachers

image.altText: Portrait of a smiling middle-aged man in a blue medical patient gown in a hospital room near a window.

props.synopsis: US man Tim Andrews has been broken the record for the longest length of time with a genetically modified animal organ. He hopes more people will receive GM pig kidneys as clinical trials ramp up.

title.children: Pig kidney recipient breaks record after eight successful months

image.altText: A man in the driver's seat of an ambulance.

props.synopsis: Peter Maxwell and wife Rachel spent a combined 77 years as NSW paramedics, but they might be the last of a generation of lifers, with one in 20 leaving the workforce every year.

title.children: 'Lifers' are a dying breed of paramedic as ambo retention plummets

image.altText: A composite image of eight book covers pictured on a green background

props.synopsis: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include the latest from literary giant Ian McEwan and Buckeye, a multigenerational family saga set in America's Midwest.

title.children: The eight books our critics couldn't put down in September

image.altText: Former FBI Director James Comey speaks to reporters on Capitol Hill.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump expects more indictments to be issued against political figures after the former FBI chief was charged.

title.children: After Comey's indictment, 'there will be others' warns Trump

image.altText: A graphic with a China flag, a rising arrow and sheep

props.synopsis: Australian wool prices lifted sharply this week for a few reasons, including a shrinking amount of wool being produced.

title.children: Wool price soars as production crashes and Chinese demand lifts

image.altText: Police officer's eyes and glasses visible in rear vision mirror, through front wind screen cars drive past on other side of road

props.synopsis: As WA experiences its worst year for road deaths in over a decade, the ABC shadows two traffic officers as they try to stop the number climbing higher.

title.children: From brutal to banal — a day in the life of a traffic cop

image.altText: A black and white professional headshot of Matthew Hopkins in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Matthew Hopkins shared racist and antisemitic material from the Neo-Nazi group on social media and described Adolf Hitler's Mein Kampf as a "brilliant book" to his followers.

title.children: Lawyer for Neo-Nazi praised Hitler's Mein Kampf as 'brilliant book'

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes breaks through a Will Kennedy tackle.

props.synopsis: Jahrome Hughes leads Melbourne back into the NRL grand final, scoring a try in a 22-14 win over the Cronulla Sharks just 22 days after breaking his arm.

title.children: Hughes defies broken arm to spark Storm into another grand final

image.altText: An image of two men composited next to each other. They both wear suits. One has short dark hair, the other has grey.

props.synopsis: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

title.children: As algal bloom recriminations grow, politicians point to the scientists

image.altText: Close up of a man in a black suit wearing headphones with a mic attached, listening intently.

props.synopsis: The UN Security Council rejects another last-ditch effort to delay the reimposition of sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program.

title.children: Iran fails to avoid 'unfair, unjust and illegal' UN sanctions

image.altText: A large blue machine squirts concrete out a nozzle onto a concrete wall while a tradie in high-viz stands next to it.

props.synopsis: A new 3D-printed home build in Victoria's west is due to be completed in October, with the construction team hoping the technology could be another solution to the housing crisis.

title.children: Builder of 3D-printed home says tech on the cusp of being the norm

image.altText: Image of mountains in the background, overlooking a coastal scene.

props.synopsis: For roughly the price of an inner-city apartment, conservationists have bought multiple small islands off the coast of Gippsland to protect their ecosystems and wildlife.

title.children: Not-for-profit buys islands off Victoria to save them from development

image.altText: A screenshot of a video where Leo is in school uniform, talking on a stage. Captions read: I have autism and ADHD.

props.synopsis: Twelve-year-old Leo is the talk of his community thanks to a speech he made for his school's public speaking competition where he opened up about his neurodiversity.

title.children: Student compares his autism to 'limited edition Lego' in viral speech

image.altText: A composite image of Suraj Raja and Nayonika Bhattacharya

props.synopsis: Nearly a month after anti-immigration protests swept across Australia, some in the Indian diaspora say they are still facing racist abuse and constantly "looking over their shoulder".

title.children: 'I feel scared like never before': Indians in Australia report rising racist abuse

image.altText: A man wearing an orange and white ski mask with a man in a suit in front of him.

props.synopsis: Chief magistrate Paul Goldspring says charges brought against Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh had been "instituted unlawfully and are null".

title.children: Terrorism case against Kneecap rapper thrown out due to technical error

image.altText: Trees lie on the ground.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's environmental regulator has issued a property owner with a vegetation conservation notice for the alleged clearing of a significant amount of native trees.

title.children: Environmental regulator probes alleged felling of native vegetation

image.altText: Eleven people, seven men and four women in suits and blazers, stand together in front of microphones in a garden.

props.synopsis: For the vast majority of Tasmanians, the six-figure salaries earnt by parliamentarians represent an entirely different world. But what's even more stark, is ministerial staff often earn much more than the MPs they work for.

title.children: They do alright, but these politicians might be the worst-paid people in the room

image.altText: An ultra close-up shot of a baby crocodile with its jaws open.

props.synopsis: Thrust back into the international spotlight by the recent trial of Outback Wrangler star Matt Wright, questions are being raised about the Top End's lucrative crocodile industry and its outdated code of practice.

title.children: The $151 million luxury industry working on outdated regulations

image.altText: Bondi to Bronte walk

props.synopsis: Disability advocates are calling for accessibility upgrades to a popular coastal walk that has been ravaged by recurring bad weather.

title.children: The bold push to make one of Australia's most scenic walkways step free
